meanings.definition: The quality of being very talkative or chatty.
meanings.sent1: Her loquaciousnesses made it hard for others to get a word in during the conversation.
meanings.sent2: His loquaciousnesses at the party kept everyone entertained with his stories.
meanings.sent3: Despite her loquaciousnesses, she was a great listener when her friends needed to talk.
meanings.sent4: The loquaciousnesses of the radio host filled the airwaves with non-stop chatter.
meanings.sent5: The loquaciousnesses of the parrot amazed everyone with its ability to mimic human speech.

meanings.definition: The state of being excessively verbose or wordy.
meanings.sent1: The loquaciousnesses of the professor made his lectures drag on longer than necessary.
meanings.sent2: His loquaciousnesses in emails often resulted in messages that were too long to read.
meanings.sent3: The loquaciousnesses of the politician's speech left the audience struggling to stay awake.
meanings.sent4: Her loquaciousnesses in writing led to essays that were filled with unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The loquaciousnesses of the advertisement made it hard to find the important information quickly.
